Hi I don't make steam reviews like, ever but I loved this game so much I have to.

One of the most difficult games I've ever played. Enjoyable, tightly designed battle system with constant 90 degree difficulty spikes. Not for the faint of heart. My only real complaint is that it's tutorial could DEFINITELY be better. 

I'll admit I got stuck at SEVERAL points in the game, but if you're willing to put the time in and learn and respect the game's mechanics I'd genuinely say this is one of if not the best games I've played and definitely worth playing.

Not going to go into the story beyond just saying that it's good. It does a really good job expanding the setting and giving more context for the world after playing Lobotomy Corporation, their previous game which was a lot (imo) less focused on the setting outside of the building.

If you care at all about the story or anything I'd genuinely recommend just not looking up anything at all about the game online or engaging with the community because in my experience Project Moon fans are extremely gung ho when it comes to just spoiling stuff for no reason.

Music's incredible, no notes.
While other games challenge your reflexes, memory and critical thinking, this one just tests your reading comprehension.

I'll keep this review relatively short (compared to my other reviews) as truly dissecting Ruina is a lengthy effort and you are not here for that, are you?

I'll just say that as someone who started with Limbus Company (the game after Ruina), I was suprised just how good gameplay can Project Moon make, I always knew the story will be amazing (which it was) as that is my favorite part of Limbus, but I thought the gameplay will be simplistic and easy like their later gacha gem.

What suprised me is the sheer variety of builds and ways to play Ruina and the amount of skill to do so. This game is hard and learning how to make effective card combinations and builds will be deciding factor between dropping the game at Queen of Hatred or not.

If you however persist and this game *clicks*, it becomes one of the best deck building/turn based experiences I played and I mean overall, from music to world building.

My final grade is 10/10, which in my turn doesn't mean the game is without faults, it is however one of the best experiences I ever had with a video game and I hope that Ruina becomes more well known and can sit alongside indie titans like Undertale.

Start of the game is miserable. The story lacks sense and keeps introducing random characters that proceed to immediately die and never be mentioned again, on top of both spoiling the lore of the previous game but also contradicting it. The gameplay is boring (basically a point and click since the bit of strategy you'd expect is ruined by the dependance on luck) and particularly RNG based (Speed values, enemy targetting, clash and attack power on combat pages). Some fights are essentially impossible because the enemy just gets more attacks per turn than you do ensuring you are guaranteed to take damage and the only solution for this is to ***at random*** obtain a key page with more attack slots as a reward from a stage, which is NOT guaranteed and you therefore could just never get one and be stuck, unless you waste time grinding some boring level over and over again. Game is extremely buggy and has a tendency to just delete my combat pages during librarian customisation without making them be re-equippable or anything afterwards which means they're stuck with weaker attacks unless I go back to mf grinding for the combat pages. You also need to grind to even be able to play or progress the story whatsoever since stages require books to enter but the stages you need to grind on also require books to enter, which means basically failing one of the aforementioned impossible levels means you will have to waste a lot of time just to get a chance at trying again. Bashing your head against a brick wall feels the same as this game but it at least has tangible results. Genuinely see no reason to ever play this over Lobotomy corporation or Limbus company, especially since the latter is free.
People in the community all say that it gets better later on and that you could just download mods to skip the grinding and whatnot but honestly, if you need to download mods and spend hours enduring the mindnumbingly mediocre gameplay just for it to start becoming playable, then the game isn't good. Don't waste your time or money on this.

TLDR : Senseless story, unfun gameplay (repetitive, completely RNG based, extremely grindy, losses are punishing but victories aren't rewarding). Start of the game is miserable. The story lacks sense and keeps introducing random characters that proceed to immediately die and never be mentioned again, on top of both spoiling the lore of the previous game but also contradicting it. The gameplay is boring (basically a point and click since the bit of strategy you'd expect is ruined by the dependance on luck) and particularly RNG based (Speed values, enemy targetting, clash and attack power on combat pages). Some fights are essentially impossible because the enemy just gets more attacks per turn than you do ensuring you are guaranteed to take damage and the only solution for this is to ***at random*** obtain a key page with more attack slots as a reward from a stage, which is NOT guaranteed and you therefore could just never get one and be stuck, unless you waste time grinding some boring level over and over again. Game is extremely buggy and has a tendency to just delete my combat pages during librarian customisation without making them be re-equippable or anything afterwards which means they're stuck with weaker attacks unless I go back to mf grinding for the combat pages. You also need to grind to even be able to play or progress the story whatsoever since stages require books to enter but the stages you need to grind on also require books to enter, which means basically failing one of the aforementioned impossible levels means you will have to waste a lot of time just to get a chance at trying again. Bashing your head against a brick wall feels the same as this game but it at least has tangible results. Genuinely see no reason to ever play this over Lobotomy corporation or Limbus company, especially since the latter is free.
People in the community all say that it gets better later on and that you could just download mods to skip the grinding and whatnot but honestly, if you need to download mods and spend hours enduring the mindnumbingly mediocre gameplay just for it to start becoming playable, then the game isn't good. Don't waste your time or money on this.

TLDR : Senseless story, unfun gameplay (repetitive, completely RNG based, extremely grindy, losses are punishing but victories aren't rewarding). Only good parts are the soundtrack and the art and you can just find those online so you might as well go and look them up instead of forcing yourself to play this utter mess.
Painful game to play; the UI is simply terrible. Their next game also became a gacha. I won't buy anything else from this company.
